header: Criminal Bail Application No.79/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­ 000310­2019 Vishwas Shantaram Waghmare …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.06/2019, registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

under section 420 r/w 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Waghmare for the applicant.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Waghmare for the applicant.

arguments.text: [3] In another Cri. Bail Application No. 64/2019, arising out of the same crime, this court has today granted ad­interim protection to the applicants. Considering the nature of the offence and the protection granted to the other applicants in another bail application, arising out of the same crime, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: Bail Application No. 64/2019, arising out of the same crime, this court has today granted ad­interim protection to the applicants.
Considering the nature of the offence and the protection granted to the other applicants in another bail application, arising out of the same crime, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Vishwas Shantaram Waghmare in C. R. No. 06/2019, registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Pune, Dated/­04­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 79/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­ 000310­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No.79/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­ 000310­2019 Vishwas Shantaram Waghmare …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.06/2019, registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Waghmare for the applicant. 
---argument-ends---
[3] In another Cri. Bail Application No. 64/2019, arising out of the same crime, this court has today granted ad­interim protection to the applicants. Considering the nature of the offence and the protection granted to the other applicants in another bail application, arising out of the same crime, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Vishwas Shantaram Waghmare in C. R. No. 06/2019, registered by Sangavi Police Station, under Section 420 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 19­01­2019. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 19­01­ 2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­04­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 79/2019 3 CNR No.MHPU01­ 000310­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 15 and ASJ, Pune. Judgment signed by PO on : ­4­1­2019 Judgment uploaded on :­ 5­1­2019
